activities.loc: Branch I, Courthouse Annex, Second Floor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy Sue Lance

records.addlTxt:

Court calls case 22CF101 & 22tr507
Atty Moss is being heard - still waiting for lab results
ADA is being heard - reschedule for hearing in January
Court schedules Status
11:04 AM
Status conference scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Amy Sue Lance
Current: 301 Washington St, c/o Oconto County Jail, Oconto, WI 54153 United States  (Effective: 10-04-2022)
Prior: 1275 Shawano Ave # 1, Green Bay, WI 54303

3:00 PM Defendant Amy Sue Lance appeared by ZOOM video (@ Oconto Co. jail).  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Amy Sue Lance.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty David Moss appeared in court.
Atty Spansail is heard, Atty Moss represents Def in another matter. 
Atty Moss agrees to represent on this case.
Court allows Atty Spansail to withdraw
Court schedules status conf as requested by Atty Moss
3:04 PM
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:13 PM Defendant Amy Sue Lance in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Amy Sue Lance.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CF101 and 22TR507.
Atty Spansail heard - case has been resolved.
Requests a plea date be set due to deft's mandatory incarceration at time of plea.
ADA no objection.
Court schedules with parties.
2:15 PM
Plea hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

4:09 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amy Sue Lance in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Amy Sue Lance. 
w/22CF101, 22TR507
Copy of Info file 6-29-22, tracks comp.
Atty Spansail - agrees, waives reading, enters n/g pleas.

3:18PM

Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amy Sue Lance in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Amy Sue Lance. 
3:13 p.m.
Court also calls 22TR507.
Prelim Questionnaire/Waiver filed.
Court finds Deft freely waives prelim.
Deft bound over for trial.
Atty Spansail will be filing substitution.
3:16 p.m.
Arraignment scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

9:03 AM Defendant Amy Sue Lance in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Amy Sue Lance.  Attorney Robert Mraz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Spansail heard - has reviewed with deft.
Deft understands.
Waives formal readings.
Enters not guilty pleas.
Requests prelim.
Atty Spansail heard - deft has notified that she may hire a private attorney.
Court informs of immediate incarceration upon plea.
Deft understands.
Court schedules with parties.
9:05 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:30 AM Defendant Amy Sue Lance appeared by video.  Attorney DeShea Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail appears for bond purposes only.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Spansail heard - has reviewed complaint with deft.
Deft understands.
DA heard on bond recommendation.
Court heard and imposes $2500 cash bond w/ conditions, sign waiver of extradition, no operating a motor vehicle without a valid license, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid RX, no entry into any bars, taverns, liquor stores whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
Court schedules with parties.
11:35 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
